duration.description: The effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

required_for.description: You conjure a non-living object at a point they choose within range. The object is no larger than a 5 foot cube, and it must be of a form and material that you have seen before.

backgrounds.name: Artisan
backgrounds.feature: Materials at Cost: You can spend gold to replicate the effects of Fabricate and Creation, at 3/4ths the normal cost.

backgrounds.name: Soldier
backgrounds.feature: Relentless Endurance: Whenever you would drop unconscious, you can make an endurance check, with the DC equal to (20 - 2* the number of HP you had before the attack).  If you succeed, you remain conscious at 1 HP, though any injury effects remain.

backgrounds.name: Urchin
backgrounds.feature: Hide in Plain Sight: You can hide if you are only lightly obscured in an urban setting.

backgrounds.name: Criminal
backgrounds.feature: Dirty Trick: As a 3 tick action, you can attempt a Deception check opposed by a target's Insight, so long as the target is in melee range. If you succeed, your next attack against the target has advantage.

backgrounds.name: Sailor
backgrounds.feature: Sea Legs: If you would be knocked prone, you can use your reaction to be pushed 10 feet.  If you would be subject to forced movement, you can use your reaction to instead fall prone.

backgrounds.name: Acolyte
backgrounds.feature: Pure Faith: You have advantage on Composure, Perception and Insight checks to stave off doubt, see through illusions, etc.

backgrounds.name: Merchant
backgrounds.feature: Everyone Has a Price: You can pay people 75 Gold to function as a scroll of Charm Person.

backgrounds.name: Hermit
backgrounds.feature: Mask of the Wild: You can hide in natural settings so long as you are at least partially obscured.

backgrounds.name: Scholar
backgrounds.feature: Helpful Advice: Whenever someone makes a check with a skill you have proficiency with, you can attempt to help them for 10 ticks. You make the same check. If you succeed, they gain advantage on their check. If you fail, they gain disadvantage.

backgrounds.name: Spy
backgrounds.feature: Mask of Many Faces: You can use a disguise kit to alter how you look extensively, even imitating a specific person.

backgrounds.name: Reaver
backgrounds.feature: Powerful Swings: Whenever you score a critical hit, you deal an additional HP of damage.

backgrounds.name: Courtier
backgrounds.feature:
Social Graces: Pick one:
• Whenever you notice that someone is lying (through an Insight check or otherwise) you can attempt a Charisma (Persuasion) check to trap them conversationally, revealing the lie
• Whenever you succeed on a Charisma (Persuasion) check to ingratiate yourself with someone, you can slip small lies about yourself or your companions into the conversation without having to attempt a Charisma (Deception) check
• Whenever you attempt a Charisma (Deception) check, you are aware of how well your lies landed, and what the sticking points are, if any.

backgrounds.name: Spirit-Blooded
backgrounds.feature: Darkvision: You can see in the dark out to a range of 60 feet.

backgrounds.name: Slave
backgrounds.feature: Make the Best of It: Once per session you can swap an HM point for a Hero Point.

backgrounds.name: Noble
backgrounds.feature: Royal Blood: If you fail a check, you can attempt a DC 17 Composure check. If you succeed, you can re-attempt the roll, with advantage. If you fail, or fail the subsequent check, you take a hit point of damage, with no injury.

backgrounds.name: Scout
backgrounds.feature: Step of the Wild: Whenever you take a move action, you move as though you had spend 2 more ticks on the action.

backgrounds.name: Laborer
backgrounds.feature: Stone’s Endurance: After gaining an injury, you can use your reaction to make an Endurance check, rerolling the injury with a bonus equal to (18 - your result).

backgrounds.name: Entertainer
backgrounds.feature: Charmer: You may attempt Persuasion checks to replicate the effect of the Calm Emotions spell, so long as every target is humanoid. Targets oppose with Insight.

class_features.name: Death is Scary
class_features.description: Whenever you kill a creature, you can use your reaction to make an Intimidating Presence check.

class_features.name: Take Aim
class_features.description: So long as you don't move on your turn, you can use a bonus action to gain advantage on an attack against a creature you attacked last round.

class_features.name: Hunter’s Mark
class_features.description: Choose a creature within 30 feet. You get +1d6 to damage rolls against it.  Only one creature can have your mark on it at a time.

class_features.name: Empty the Clip
class_features.description: You can make multiple attacks simultaneously, spending ticks for each.  Each attack has disadvantage.

class_features.name: Brace
class_features.description: If you have cover, you can give up that cover until your next turn to gain advantage on your next attack roll.

class_features.name: Intimidating Presence
class_features.description: Choose a target that can see or hear you and make an Intimidation check. On a success against the target’s Composure defense, the target is afraid of you.

class_features.name: Buckshot
class_features.description: You can load your weapon with a special shot for 6 ticks.  If you do, your next attack targets Acrobatics, and hits everyone in a cone.  It only rolls for injury, and doesn't deal damage.

class_features.name: Crack Shot
class_features.description: You can make opportunity attacks with your weapon, if it's loaded, other than attacks provoked by movement.

class_features.name: Miscount
class_features.description: You can attempt to fire while empty.  If your attack roll is below 15+number of powers you've used, your weapon jams and can't be used for the rest of combat.  Using this ability counts as a power.

class_features.name: Sharp Shooting
class_features.description: You can make a ranged attack with disadvantage.  If you hit, it is a critical hit.

class_features.name: Sundering Strike
class_features.description: Make an attack roll using Strength against a target within range. If you glance, you can give up other glancing effects to reduce armor style by one.

class_features.name: Too Stupid to Die
class_features.description: When you drop to 0 HP or gain the "Death" injury, you do not fall unconscious, though you still make death saving throws.  All your actions have disadvantage, and all actions against you have advantage.

class_features.name: Strength of Mountains
class_features.description: If you attack with a martial melee weapon on a slow attack, add the dice together instead of taking the highest one.

class_features.name: Step of the Wild
class_features.description: Whenever you take a move action, you move as though you had spent 2 more ticks.

class_features.name: Barbaric Yawp
class_features.description: Choose one creature within Long range and make a Power roll using your Constitution score. On a success against the target’s Wisdom defense, the target is frightened of you until the end of combat.

class_features.name: Hit Die Splitting
class_features.description: Whenever an effect would allow you to spend a Hit Die, you can instead spend 1d4 instead of 2d4.

class_features.name: Charge
class_features.description: You can move and attack on the same turn.  You pay the full tick cost

class_features.name: Vicious Mockery
class_features.description: CHA vs AC, Mind Damage

class_features.name: Friends
class_features.description: You gain advantage on CHA checks.  Interacting with creatures in this way clearly influences them magically, and they will react as such 1 minute after the interaction

class_features.name: Entrancing Gaze
class_features.description: Choose a target that can see or hear you and make a Power roll. On a success, the target is unaware of anything but you.

class_features.name: Telepathy
class_features.description: You can communicate telepathically with creatures you are aware of that have language and are within 30 feet of you

class_features.name: Twist Fate
class_features.description: As Guidance, but you generate a DM point.

class_features.name: Minor Illusion
class_features.description: You create a sound or image that can fill a five-foot cube, that is as loud as a lions roar or as quiet as a whisper.  It lasts up to 1 minute

class_features.name: Reflexive Illusion
class_features.description: Creatures you are aware of have disadvantage on INT saves to pierce your illusions.

class_features.name: Bardic Doubts
class_features.description: You may spend a hit die to impose disadvantage on an attack, Power roll, or skill check. If the action fails, the target takes damage equal to a roll of the hit die you spent.

class_features.name: Hot Headed
class_features.description: You add your Charisma bonus to your initiative rolls.

class_features.name: Earthen Resilience
class_features.description: Your AC is 10 + your Proficiency modifier + your Dexterity bonus.

class_features.name: Ice Queen
class_features.description: You have advantage on Saving Throws against all effects with the mind tag.

class_features.name: Acid Splash
class_features.description: CHA vs AC, acid damage

class_features.name: Firebolt
class_features.description: CHA vs AC, 1d6 fire damage

class_features.name: Coal Walker
class_features.description: You have immunity to fire damage.

class_features.name: Ray of Frost
class_features.description: CHA vs AC, Ice Damage

class_features.name: Quick Feet
class_features.description: Whenever an attack misses you, you can move 5 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

class_features.name: Stable Roots
class_features.description: You have advantage on Saving Throws against forced movement.

class_features.name: Lightning Lure
class_features.description: CHA vs AC, lightning damage

class_features.name: Distracting Flanker
class_features.description: Whenever there are more allies than enemies adjacent to an enemy creature, that creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.

class_features.name: Double Threat Range
class_features.description: You score critical hits (but do not generate hero points) on rolls of 14 and above.

class_features.name: Message
class_features.description: You can silently communicate a single sentence to an ally who you can see and can see you

class_features.name: Pass it On
class_features.description: If an ally has multiple sources of advantage on an attack roll, they can grant advantage to an ally's next attack, so long as that Ally is visible and within 30 feet.

class_features.name: Comfortable Plates
class_features.description: Wearing heavy armor does not reduce your move speed.

class_features.name: Sword Burst
class_features.description: You can attack each creature adjacent to you.  If you do, you only roll for injury, and inflict no damage.  This attack cannot glance

class_features.name: Spellstrike
class_features.description: Whenever you hit with a melee attack, you can use any powers from the Debuff tree as a reaction.

class_features.name: Telekinetic Shove
class_features.description: For 5 ticks, you may push or pull a target 5 feet.  An unwilling target must succeed on an Athletics roll to avoid the movement.

class_features.name: Booming Blade
class_features.description: STR vs AC.  If you hit the target, you can make an attack as a reaction if it attacks anyone else on its turn, or if it leaves your threat range

class_features.name: Aura of Courage
class_features.description: Allies within 5 feet of you gain advantage on Athletics, Endurance, and Composure checks.

class_features.name: True Strike
class_features.description: 10 ticks - your next glancing attack against the target is considered a normal hit

class_features.name: Spare the Dying
class_features.description: You can make medicine checks to stabilize creatures as a 5 tick action

class_features.name: Noble Mien
class_features.description: If your proficiency in a CHA skill is higher than an Ally's, that Ally gains advantage on that check.

class_features.name: Dueling
class_features.description: If no allies are adjacent to or attacking an enemy, you have advantage on melee attacks against that enemy.

class_features.name: Lay on Hands
class_features.description: You can spend your hit dice to heal others.

class_features.name: Bodyguard
class_features.description: Whenever a creature adjacent to you takes damage, you can use your reaction to take that damage instead.

class_features.name: Battlefield Medicine
class_features.description: You may attempt a DC 18 Medicine check. If you succeed, a target you touch can expend two HD to gain the benefit of healing (i.e. they only heal a number of HP equal to 1 roll of their hit die).

class_features.name: Polymorphic Casting
class_features.description: You can cast spells while polymorphed. You do so with disadvantage.

class_features.name: Vitality
class_features.description: You may have your healing act as temp HP that lasts until the next rest, rather than normal healing.

class_features.name: Toll the Dead
class_features.description: WIS vs AC, short range.  You can choose which injury table to roll on, and roll damage as though it was a martial weapon if the target has fewer than full hit points.

class_features.name: Touch of Calm
class_features.description: WIS vs Composure, target is calmed and won't attack until you or an ally takes a hostile action.

class_features.name: Primal Savagery
class_features.description: You gain an unarmed attack that counts as martial for damage purposes, and access to the bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing trees

class_features.name: Magic Stone
class_features.description: For 5 ticks, you imbue a number of pieces of ammunition equal to your proficiency modifier with natural energy.  Until the end of combat, attacks with the ammunition roll an additional d6 and take the highest result

class_features.name: Woodland Stride
class_features.description: You ignore difficult terrain from the plant, earth, and ice tags.

class_features.name: Sustained Concentration
class_features.description: You have advantage on Concentration saves when in a form other than your natural form.

class_features.name: Skill Expertise
class_features.description: Choose a skill, you double your proficiency bonus for active checks with that skill

class_features.name: Always Disengage
class_features.description: Your movement never provokes attacks of opportunity

class_features.name: Distracting Trick
class_features.description: Make a Dexterity roll. On a success against the Wisdom defenses of everyone within 30 feet, everyone’s attention is drawn to a point you choose within range.

class_features.name: Vanish
class_features.description: You can hide as a 5 tick action instead of a 10 tick action

class_features.name: Tool Expertise
class_features.description: Choose a skill - you can take 10 minutes to double your proficiency with active checks in that skill

class_features.name: Mage Hand
class_features.description: You gain the ability to manipulate objects at range, acting quickly and quietly.  You can only manipulate objects that weigh 5 pounds or less and are within 30 feet.  You have disadvantage on Sleight-of-Hand checks at range

class_features.name: Quick Blade
class_features.description: All movement provokes attacks of opportunity from you.

class_features.name: Death is Scary
class_features.description: Whenever you kill a creature, you can use your reaction to make an Intimidating Presence check.

class_features.name: Take Aim
class_features.description: So long as you don't move on your turn, you can use a bonus action to gain advantage on an attack against a creature you attacked last round.

class_features.name: Hunter’s Mark
class_features.description: Choose a creature within 30 feet. You get +1d6 to damage rolls against it.  Only one creature can have your mark on it at a time.

class_features.name: Empty the Clip
class_features.description: You can make multiple attacks simultaneously, spending ticks for each.  Each attack has disadvantage.

class_features.name: Brace
class_features.description: If you have cover, you can give up that cover until your next turn to gain advantage on your next attack roll.

class_features.name: Intimidating Presence
class_features.description: Choose a target that can see or hear you and make an Intimidation check. On a success against the target’s Composure defense, the target is afraid of you.

class_features.name: Buckshot
class_features.description: You can load your weapon with a special shot for 6 ticks.  If you do, your next attack targets Acrobatics, and hits everyone in a cone.  It only rolls for injury, and doesn't deal damage.

class_features.name: Crack Shot
class_features.description: You can make opportunity attacks with your weapon, if it's loaded, other than attacks provoked by movement.

class_features.name: Miscount
class_features.description: You can attempt to fire while empty.  If your attack roll is below 15+number of powers you've used, your weapon jams and can't be used for the rest of combat.  Using this ability counts as a power.

class_features.name: Sharp Shooting
class_features.description: You can make a ranged attack with disadvantage.  If you hit, it is a critical hit.

class_features.name: Minor Conjuration
class_features.description: You can conjure up an inanimate object in your hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space that you can see within 10 feet of you. This object can be no larger than 3 feet on a side and weigh no more than 10 pounds, and its form must be that of a nonmagical object that you have seen. The object is visibly magical, radiating dim light out to 5 feet.

class_features.name: Frostbite
class_features.description: INT vs AC, Cold damage.  You can forgo the damage to instead inflict the speed halved injury

class_features.name: Grim Harvest
class_features.description: Whenever a creature with one of your spells on it dies, you can spend a Hit Die.

class_features.name: Elemental Attunement
class_features.description: Your arcane ward is not vulnerable to an element of your choice

class_features.name: Unseen Servant
class_features.description: You bind a small spirit to obey your commands.  The spirit lasts for 1 hour, and can be commanded as a 5 tick action.  It cannot attack, but can perform minor actions a human servant would.  It has 1 hit point

class_features.name: Arcane Deflection
class_features.description: When you are hit by an attack, you can attempt a Power check as a reaction to force the target to reroll. The DC is the attack result. This counts as casting a spell for your spells per rest.

class_features.name: Arcane Ward
class_features.description: At the beginning of a long rest, and whenever you successfully cast an Abjuration spell, you gain an Arcane Ward. The ward has HP equal to your proficiency bonus, vulnerability to all damage, and you can use your reaction to interpose it against any attack within 30 feet.

class_features.name: Thunderclap
class_features.description: INT vs AC, targets each creature around you.  Inflicts an injury, but deals no damage

class_features.name: Minor Alchemy
class_features.description: You can temporarily alter the physical properties of one nonmagical object, changing it from one substance into another. You perform a special alchemical procedure on one object composed entirely of wood, stone (but not a gemstone), iron, copper, or silver, transforming it into a different one of those materials. For each 10 minutes you spend performing the procedure, you can transform up to 1 cubic foot of material. After 1 hour, or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell), the material reverts to its original substance.

class_features.name: Portent
class_features.description: When you finish a long rest, roll 3d6 and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with the foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll.

Piercing.name: Glance True
Piercing.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing spell, you can inflict an injury (without dealing damage) without provoking opportunity attacks.

required_for.name: Constant Glancing
required_for.description: You score a glancing hit against a creature on a roll that equals 10 minus their AC, rather than 5 minus their AC.

required_for.name: Lead the Way
required_for.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing effect, the next glancing hit against the target before the end of your next turn is a normal hit.

Piercing.name: Lead the Way

requires.name: Glance True
requires.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing spell, you can inflict an injury (without dealing damage) without provoking opportunity attacks.

Piercing.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing effect, the next glancing hit against the target before the end of your next turn is a normal hit.

Piercing.name: Constant Glancing

requires.name: Glance True
requires.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing spell, you can inflict an injury (without dealing damage) without provoking opportunity attacks.

Piercing.description: You score a glancing hit against a creature on a roll that equals 10 minus their AC, rather than 5 minus their AC.

required_for.name: Glance Deep
required_for.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing spell, you can inflict a point of damage (without rolling for an injury) without provoking opportunity attacks.

Piercing.name: Glance Deep

requires.name: Constant Glancing
requires.description: You score a glancing hit against a creature on a roll that equals 10 minus their AC, rather than 5 minus their AC.

Piercing.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing spell, you can inflict a point of damage (without rolling for an injury) without provoking opportunity attacks.

Slashing.name: Dervish I
Slashing.description: Whenever you hit a creature with a slashing attack, if you surpass the AC of adjacent creatures, you can deal a glancing hit to them.

required_for.name: Dervish II
required_for.description: As Dervish, but the hits on adjacent creatures are full hits instead of glancing hits.

Slashing.name: Critical I
Slashing.description: When you score a critical hit using a power with the slashing tag, you deal an additional point of damage.

required_for.name: Critical II
required_for.description: When you score a critical hit using a power with the slashing tag, you double your damage.

Slashing.name: Dervish II

requires.name: Dervish I
requires.description: Whenever you hit a creature with a slashing attack, if you surpass the AC of adjacent creatures, you can deal a glancing hit to them.

Slashing.description: As Dervish, but the hits on adjacent creatures are full hits instead of glancing hits.

Slashing.name: Critical II

requires.name: Critical I
requires.description: When you score a critical hit using a power with the slashing tag, you deal an additional point of damage.

Slashing.description: When you score a critical hit using a power with the slashing tag, you double your damage.

Slashing.name: Critical Bleeding

requires.name: Critical Bleeding
requires.description: Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing spell, the target takes another point of damage at the start of your next turn.

Slashing.description: Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing spell, the target takes another point of damage at the start of your next turn.

required_for.name: Critical Bleeding
required_for.description: Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing spell, the target takes another point of damage at the start of your next turn.

Bludgeoning.name: No Reaction
Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Composure Defence, they can’t take reactions until their next turn.

required_for.name: Mind Spike
required_for.description: If the attack beats the target’s Composure Defence, they can’t take reactions until their next turn, and can’t take the same action on their next turn they took on their previous turn

Bludgeoning.name: Prone
Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Endurance Defence, it knocks them prone

Bludgeoning.name: Bull Rush
Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Athletics Defence, you can push them back 5*proficiency modifier feet

required_for.name: Disarm
required_for.description: If the attack beats the target’s Athletics Defence, it knocks them prone

Bludgeoning.name: Attack Advantage
Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Insight Defence, attacks against the target have advantage until the end of your next turn

Bludgeoning.name: Disarm

requires.name: Bull Rush
requires.description: If the attack beats the target’s Athletics Defence, you can push them back 5*proficiency modifier feet

Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Athletics Defence, it knocks them prone

Bludgeoning.name: Mind Spike

requires.name: No Reaction
requires.description: If the attack beats the target’s Composure Defence, they can’t take reactions until their next turn.

Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Composure Defence, they can’t take reactions until their next turn, and can’t take the same action on their next turn they took on their previous turn

None.name: Empty the Clip

None.description: You can make multiple attacks simultaneously, spending ticks for each.  Each attack has disadvantage.

None.name: Sharp Shooting

requires.name: Take Aim
requires.description: So long as you don't move on your turn, you can use a bonus action to gain advantage on an attack against a creature you attacked last round.

None.description: You can make a ranged attack with disadvantage.  If you hit, it is a critical hit.

None.name: Acolyte
None.feature: Pure Faith: You have advantage on Composure, Perception and Insight checks to stave off doubt, see through illusions, etc.

None.name: Artisan
None.feature: Materials at Cost: You can spend gold to replicate the effects of Fabricate and Creation, at 3/4ths the normal cost.

None.name: Courtier
None.feature:
Social Graces: Pick one:
• Whenever you notice that someone is lying (through an Insight check or otherwise) you can attempt a Charisma (Persuasion) check to trap them conversationally, revealing the lie
• Whenever you succeed on a Charisma (Persuasion) check to ingratiate yourself with someone, you can slip small lies about yourself or your companions into the conversation without having to attempt a Charisma (Deception) check
• Whenever you attempt a Charisma (Deception) check, you are aware of how well your lies landed, and what the sticking points are, if any.

None.name: Criminal
None.feature: Dirty Trick: As a 3 tick action, you can attempt a Deception check opposed by a target's Insight, so long as the target is in melee range. If you succeed, your next attack against the target has advantage.

None.name: Entertainer
None.feature: Charmer: You may attempt Persuasion checks to replicate the effect of the Calm Emotions spell, so long as every target is humanoid. Targets oppose with Insight.

None.name: Hermit
None.feature: Mask of the Wild: You can hide in natural settings so long as you are at least partially obscured.

None.name: Laborer
None.feature: Stone’s Endurance: After gaining an injury, you can use your reaction to make an Endurance check, rerolling the injury with a bonus equal to (18 - your result).

None.name: Merchant
None.feature: Everyone Has a Price: You can pay people 75 Gold to function as a scroll of Charm Person.

None.name: Noble
None.feature: Royal Blood: If you fail a check, you can attempt a DC 17 Composure check. If you succeed, you can re-attempt the roll, with advantage. If you fail, or fail the subsequent check, you take a hit point of damage, with no injury.

None.name: Reaver
None.feature: Powerful Swings: Whenever you score a critical hit, you deal an additional HP of damage.

None.name: Sailor
None.feature: Sea Legs: If you would be knocked prone, you can use your reaction to be pushed 10 feet.  If you would be subject to forced movement, you can use your reaction to instead fall prone.

None.name: Scholar
None.feature: Helpful Advice: Whenever someone makes a check with a skill you have proficiency with, you can attempt to help them for 10 ticks. You make the same check. If you succeed, they gain advantage on their check. If you fail, they gain disadvantage.

None.name: Scout
None.feature: Step of the Wild: Whenever you take a move action, you move as though you had spend 2 more ticks on the action.

None.name: Slave
None.feature: Make the Best of It: Once per session you can swap an HM point for a Hero Point.

None.name: Soldier
None.feature: Relentless Endurance: Whenever you would drop unconscious, you can make an endurance check, with the DC equal to (20 - 2* the number of HP you had before the attack).  If you succeed, you remain conscious at 1 HP, though any injury effects remain.

None.name: Spirit-Blooded
None.feature: Darkvision: You can see in the dark out to a range of 60 feet.

None.name: Spy
None.feature: Mask of Many Faces: You can use a disguise kit to alter how you look extensively, even imitating a specific person.

None.name: Urchin
None.feature: Hide in Plain Sight: You can hide if you are only lightly obscured in an urban setting.
